title: God’s Covenant with Noah
summary: Genesis 9 outlines God's covenant with Noah, including the rainbow as a sign. God reaffirms the value of life and commands Noah’s descendants to multiply. The chapter ends with Noah’s sons and an incident involving Ham.

faq.question: What is the sign of God’s covenant with Noah?
faq.answer: The rainbow, representing God's promise never to flood the earth again.

faq.question: Why was Ham cursed?
faq.answer: Ham dishonored his father Noah by exposing his nakedness, leading Noah to curse Ham's son, Canaan.

faq.question: What does Genesis 9:4 mean when it says not to eat meat with 'lifeblood' in it?
faq.answer: This means people could eat meat, but they had to drain the blood first. In ancient times, blood was seen as the life of an animal. God wanted people to treat life with respect, even when eating.
